page.title: 16EMPLOYMENT IN CARMARTHEN
page.content: JOB CENTRE We went down to the job centre in Carmarthen to ask Mr.Evans questions. The part time jobs are difficult t0 get.Nobody wants the catering jobs.You are most likely to get a job if you are over 25-35.If you are over 50 it is more difficult. Popular jobs are clerical,labouring and shopwork and about 150-200 people come in each week to look for a job. The average unemployment rate in the Carmarthen area is 9.2% but it is about 15% nationally. Often the first person to apply for a job gets it but for some jobs over 100 people apply. Mr. Evans,the supervisor,thought that conditions are improving during 1985 and that employment prospects should gradually improve. Karen Beardmore, Jessica Murphy and Cathy Brennan.
